episodes.title: DECULT VOICES - BEYOND BELIEF │Full Documentary
episodes.description:
Filmed during the first Decult conference in Ōtautahi Christchurch (Aotearoa New Zealand) in 2024, this documentary weaves together raw, unscripted insights from cult survivors, mental health professionals, human rights advocates, authors, journalists and academic experts. 

Dr Janja Lalich, Dr Gillie Jenkinson, Hon Dr Duncan Webb, Maria Esguerra, Craig Hoyle, Scott Homan, Lara Kaput, Laura McConnell Conti, Pearl Valor, Rachel Lees, Virginia Courage, Dr Caroline Ansley, Lindy Jacomb, Andre Afamasaga, Anke Richter and many others present their deeply moving reflections and bold public calls to action, challenging long-held assumptions about people who left cults. 

From powerful stories of exit and recovery to a united push for systemic reform, this fully crowdfunded film is a rallying cry for accountability, compassion and justice. 

Film production by Caleb MacDonald and Robyn Jordaan 

Take action and sign up for the Decult newsletter: https://decult.net/ 

Learn more about Decult 2026: https://decult.net/conference-2026/

Please support Decult: https://decult.net/donate/

episodes.title: “Freedom Blues” by Bruce Thompson at Decult 2024 – Cult Survivor Story Jam
episodes.description:
This song was written by musician Bruce Thompson in the UK. He was born into the Exclusive Brethren (PBCC) and left with his young family in 2022. While inside, he witnessed firsthand the cover-up of childhood sexual abuse, the central role money played in maintaining control, and the worship of one man on earth. This song is about his journey to freedom and breaking free from an oppressive environment. “Freedom Blues”, which he wrote, reflects his new chapter of life and liberation. It was performed by Californian musician Dave Booda at the end of the live-streamed Cult Survivor Story Jam at Decult 2024, New Zealand’s first cult awareness conference.

Find more info about Decult on https://decult.net/

episodes.title: Luke Hollis - Jehovas Witness Survivor
episodes.description: Luke Hollis, a survivor of childhood sexual abuse within Jehovah’s Witness, will speak at Decult 2024. Despite efforts to conceal his abuse, his mental health suffered greatly. Now, he uses his story and psychology studies to inspire others.
